abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the Energy
            Efficiency Project for Serbia are: (a) improving energy
            efficiency in heating buildings in order to make heating
            more affordable and improving functional and health
            environment of the users; and (b) reducing the local and
            global environmental impact of the use of dirty fuels for
            heating buildings) and monitoring indicators have remained
            unchanged. The closing date for the project will be extended
            from October 31, 2011, until April 30, 2013. The
            requirements of OP/BP13.30 have been met, namely, (a) the
            project objectives continue to be achievable; (b) the
            performance of the Borrower and other project implementing
            agencies is satisfactory; and (c) the Borrower has prepared
            a specific Action Plan acceptable to the Bank to complete
            the project within the proposed extended timeframe. There
            are no outstanding audits. This will be the second extension
            of the closing date and will result in a cumulative
            extension of over two years from the original closing date
            (April 30, 2010).
